newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: MALAYSIA STOCKS - FACTORS TO WATCH - AUG 14.
newsitem.headline: MALAYSIA STOCKS - FACTORS TO WATCH - AUG 14.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Malaysian stocks on Thursday:

* Ringgit recovers slightly on Thursday morning to 2.7605/35 a dollar against 2.78 at close of Kuala Lumpur on Wednesday after Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad said Malaysia would cut imports and review implementation of projects.
* On Tuesday, the Dow Jones Industrial Average fell by a further 32.5 points to new three-week low of 7,928 on new fears over slowing U.S. economy and weakening dollar
* The Kuala Lumpur Composite Index recovers in a technical rebound to end 11.58 points higher at 908.83
* "The recovery from yesterday should continue. But there is still currency uncertainty," said Phua Lee Kerk, head of research at Jupiter Securities.

* Dealers said Mahathir's statement about reducing imports, reviewing projects in the wake of falling ringgit and plans of introducing tax on speculative foreign exchange trading was not entirely clear to market.
* "The government is confusing people by saying too many things," a dealer said.
* Dealers said UMW Holdings, which reported 69 percent rise in first half net profit, would be in focus along with most blue chips.
